p: Countries
Industry leaders choose us

At Moolya Software Testing Private Limited, we are a global leader in AI-driven engineering solutions, specializing in creating scalable, secure, and intelligent platforms that transform business outcomes. We collaborate with forward-thinking organizations to build high-impact products that leverage cutting-edge technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Generative AI, and advanced data analytics. Our expertise spans across AI platform engineering, software development, and quality assurance, ensuring measurable success for our clients.
We go beyond vendor roles, fostering deep co-ownership with customers.
Moolya unifies Tech, Test, Product, Customer & Business insights to scale value.

p: Keysight Technologies empowers innovators to design and deliver next-generation solutions with precision, speed, and confidence.

Moolya proposes a DevOps Implementation and Managed Operations solution to strengthen Keysight’s software delivery ecosystem through a self-managed Kubernetes platform on AWS, integrated with your existing toolchain Jenkins, Polaris, Black Duck, and Vault.
This initiative will:
Together, we’ll enable Keysight to deliver faster, operate securely, and scale seamlessly, supporting your vision of engineering excellence.
list: Accelerate deployment cycles through automated CI/CD and secure pipelines.
Enhance governance and compliance via Polaris and Black Duck integration.
Ensure continuous reliability with Vault-based secrets, ACM certificates, and AWS observability.

h1: Implementing Kubernetes and CI/CD Enhancements Alongside Existing Workloads

blocks.text: Implementing Kubernetes and CI/CD Enhancements Alongside Existing Workloads

p: Goal: Build AWS infrastructure, implement Kubernetes cluster, and establish the security foundation. Deliverables: Implement Kubernetes clusters (Dev/Staging/Prod). Vault integration and initial secret policies. Terraform IaC modules and state management repository. Security and access governance documentation. ACM-based SSL/TLS automation.
table: Shadow existing DevOps engineer; assess current workload configurations while maintaining daily operations
Define AWS architecture (VPC, subnets, IAM), cluster node design, and RBAC model.
Implement a self-managed Kubernetes cluster on AWS EC2 using Terraform, configuring networking, storage, and monitoring for operational readiness.
Configure ACM, Vault, and namespace isolation; enforce Pod

blocks.text: Goal: Build AWS infrastructure, implement Kubernetes cluster, and establish the security foundation. Deliverables: Implement Kubernetes clusters (Dev/Staging/Prod). Vault integration and initial secret policies. Terraform IaC modules and state management repository. Security and access governance documentation. ACM-based SSL/TLS automation.

p: Goal: Containerize workloads, automate CI/CD, and standardize secure deployment practices.
Deliverables:
Jenkins pipelines with security gates (Polaris, Black Duck).
list: Helm-based deployment automation.
Blue-Green and Canary rollout playbooks.
Rollback and release validation runbooks
CI/CD and compliance workflow documentation.
table: Deploy workloads to Kubernetes using Helm; configure Ingress and TLS with ACM.
Implement CI/CD pipelines with build → scan → deploy → rollback flow; enforce Polaris & Black Duck gates.
Implement Blue-Green and Canary deployments; integrate
Prometheus-based health checks and rollback automation.

h1: Evolving to a Fully Automated, Secure, and Always-On DevOps Ecosystem

blocks.text: Evolving to a Fully Automated, Secure, and Always-On DevOps Ecosystem

p: Quarterly Roadmap
table: Implement Kubernetes environment on AWS EC2 using Terraform; implement CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins with integrated Polaris & Black Duck scans; enable Vault-based secrets and certificate automation.
Enhance observability through Prometheus, Grafana, and CloudWatch; automate compliance reporting; validate continuous certificate renewals and security posture.
Improve cost efficiency and resource utilization; enhance Jenkins pipeline performance; implement automated configuration drift detection and remediation.
Establish DevOps governance KPIs and SLA dashboards; conduct resilience and reliability drills; introduce predictive observability and proactive alerting.

blocks.text: Implement Kubernetes environment on AWS EC2 using Terraform; implement CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins with integrated Polaris & Black Duck scans; enable Vault-based secrets and certificate automation.

h2: Leading eCommerce Enterprise -DevOps Modernization and Continuous Delivery Excellence
list: A
leading global e-commerce platform serving millions of daily active users with peak-scale traffic during major shopping events.
The engagement involved establishing a scalable, self-managed Kubernetes platform on AWS while maintaining full control of live workloads.
Took full DevOps ownership from Day l while implementing a self-managed Kubernetes platform on AWS EC2 using Terraform with zero downtime.
Re-engineered Jenkins pipelines with automated build-test-deploy flow, integrated SonarQube for quality gates, and improved release reliability.
Embedded OWASP Dependency-Check for open-source risk validation and baseline vulnerability scoring across all builds.
Implemented HashiCorp Vault and AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) for dynamic secrets rotation and automated SSL renewals.
SonarQube integration lowered high-severity issues by 70% and improved maintainability across key services.
Terraform automation and AWS resource optimization reduced infrastructure costs by -22%
OWASP Dependency-Check, Vault. and governance dashboards ensured continuous compliance and transparent reporting.

p: A supply chain and sustainability management platform designed for fashion brands across the European Union (EU), empowering them to manage operations and compliance efficiently using AWS.
list: Streamlined CI/CD Pipelines: Implemented end-to-end continuous integration and deployment pipelines using Cloudbees to ensure faster, automated, and error-free releases.
Containerization & Infrastructure as Code (laC): Migrated services to containerized environments and adopted laC (Terraform + Kubernetes) for scalable and consistent infrastructure management.
Automated Monitoring & Alerts: Set up real-time monitoring, logging, and alerting systems using Prometheus and Grafana to improve observability and system reliability,
Environment Standardization: Unified staging, QA, and production environments to eliminate configuration drift and reduce deployment risks.
Operational Agility: Enhanced platform reliability and enabled faster, more predictable releases.
Cost Optimization: Reduced infrastructure overhead through automated scaling and resource utilization monitoring.

p: Enterprise SaaS client operating legacy EC2 deployments with manual release cycles and inconsistent configuration.
list: Designed AWS multi-account strategy with centralized IAM and GuardDuty.
Containerized 40+ microservices and deployed to EKS clusters.
Implemented Terraform modules for provisioning. networking. and IAM roles.
Established Grafana dashboards for SLO tracking.
Deployment frequency increased from bi-weekly to daily.
Infrastructure drift reduced to near zero with laC adoption.
35% cost optimization through right-sized autoscaling.
Security exposure window reduced by 60% via automated scans.

p: Moolya’s DevOps Implementation and Managed Operations program establishes a secure, compliant, and fully automated DevOps ecosystem on AWS powered by Kubernetes, Jenkins, Polaris, and Black Duck.

Our deliverables provide not just automation, but visibility, governance, and confidence ensuring your infrastructure and pipelines remain continuously optimized, secure, and aligned with enterprise expectations.
This is not a one-time setup it’s a sustained evolution of your DevOps maturity model, backed by transparent reporting and measurable results.
